ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: CALEDATA=SAS-data-set] 
      
Specifies the calendar data set, a SAS data set that contains weekly work schedules 
for multiple calendars. If you omit the CALEDATA= option, then PROC CALENDAR uses a 
default work schedule.

[Syntax: DATA=SAS-data-set] 
      
Specifies the activities data set, a SAS data set that contains starting dates for all 
activities and variables to display for each activity. Activities must be sorted or 
indexed by starting date. If you omit the DATA= option, then the most recently created 
SAS data set is used.
Specifies that START and FIN variables contain values in DATETIME. format.

Gives the number of hours in a standard working day. The hour value must be a SAS TIME value. 

Default: 24 if INTERVAL=DAY (the default), 8 if INTERVAL=WORKDAY. 

Restriction: DAYLENGTH= applies only to schedule calendars.

Displays all months between the first and last activity, start and finish dates 
inclusive, including months that contain no activities.

[Syntax: FORMCHAR<(position(s))>='formatting-character(s)']
        
Defines the characters to use for constructing the outlines and dividers for the cells 
in the calendar as well as all identifying markers (such as asterisks and arrows) used 
to indicate holidays or continuation of activities in PROC CALENDAR output.
Specifies the type of heading to use in printing the name of the month.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Prints the month and year on one line.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Prints the month and year in a box four lines high. This is the default.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Prints the month seven lines high using asterisks (*). The year is included  if space is available.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies the units of the DUR and HOLIDUR variables to one of two default daylengths: DAY or WORKDAY.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies the values of the DUR and HOLIDUR variables in units of 24-hour days and  specifies the default 7-day calendar.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies the values of the DUR and HOLIDUR variables in units of 8-hour days and  specifies that the default calendar contains five days a week, Monday through  Friday, all starting at 09:00 with a length of 08:00.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: HOLIDATA=SAS-data-set] 
      
Specifies the holidays data set, a SAS data set that contains the holidays you want 
to display in the output.

Prints the names of months and weekdays in the language that is indicated by the value 
of the LOCALE= SAS system option.
Specifies the type of mean to calculate for each month.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Calculates the mean over the number of observations displayed in the month.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Calculates the mean over the number of days displayed in the month.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata: Determines how missing values are treated, based on the type of calendar.

Suppresses the display of Saturdays and Sundays in the output. It also specifies 
that the value of the INTERVAL= option is WORKDAY.

[Syntax: WORKDATA=SAS-data-set] 
      
Specifies the workdays data set, a SAS data set that defines the work pattern during 
a standard working day.

StatementHelp.#cdata: [Analyzes or processes separately for each BY group.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that 
immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.
Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.
Specifies what statistic the bars or sections in the chart represent.

StatementHelp.#cdata: Processes activities in groups defined by the values of a calendar identifier variable.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Controls the amount of space required to display output for multiple calendars.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Produces one page for each month that contains activities and subdivides each day  by the CALID value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Produces one page for each month that contains activities and does not identify  activities by the CALID value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Produces a separate page for each value of the CALID variable.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: DUR variable; ] 
        
Specifies the variable that contains the duration of each activity.

[Syntax: HOLIDUR variable; ] 
        
Specifies the variable in the holidays data set that contains the duration of each 
holiday for a schedule calendar.

[Syntax: FIN variable; ] 
        
Specifies the variable in the activities data set that contains the finishing date 
of each activity.

[Syntax: HOLIFIN variable; ] 
        
Specifies the variable in the holidays data set that contains the finishing date 
of each holiday.

[Syntax: HOLISTART variable; ] 
        
Specifies a variable in the holidays data set that contains the starting date of 
each holiday.

[Syntax: HOLIVAR variable; ] 
        
Specifies a variable in the holidays data set whose values are used to label 
the holidays.

[Syntax: MEAN variable(s) </ FORMAT=format-name>; ]
        
Specifies numeric variables in the data set for which mean values are to be calculated.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: FORMAT=format-name] 
            
Names a SAS or user-defined format to be used in displaying the means requested. 

Default: BEST. format

StatementHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: OUTDUR number-of-days; ] 
        
Specifies in days the length of the week to be displayed.

[Syntax: OUTFIN day-of-week; ] 
        
Specifies the last day of the week to display in the calendar.

[Syntax: OUTSTART day-of-week; ] 
        
Specifies the starting day of the week to display in the calendar.

[Syntax: START variable; ] 
        
Specifies the variable in the activities data set that contains the starting date of each activity.

[Syntax: VAR variable(s); ] 
        
Specifies the variables that you want to display for each activity.

[Syntax: SUM variable(s) </ FORMAT=format-name>; ]
       
Specifies numeric variables in the activities data set to total for each month.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: FORMAT=format-name] 
            
Names a SAS or user-defined format to be used in displaying the means requested. Default: BEST. format
